intro: Primula bullata var. delavayi, commonly known as the Delavay’s primrose, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of western China. It features showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, often with a distinctive yellow throat. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves that are arranged in a basal rosette, contributing to its ornamental appeal. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its unique beauty and limited distribution, it is a sought-after species in botanical gardens and conservation efforts.
